abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory,
            with sustainable likelihood, and modest institutional
            development impacts. Key lessons address: 1) The
            securitization of Bank financed assets, - in this case, the
            ownership and management change of the Hangzhou-Ningbo
            Highway (HNH) assets - was found to be a financial technique
            liable to raise new capital from foreign investors,
            including acceptance among investors in China's Stock
            markets. Moreover, this technique lead to the approval of
            the policy guidance "Securitization and other Capital
            Mobilization Transactions using Bank Financed Assets"
            in December 1997. 2) Since remedial works, needed to counter
            the soil settlement problem were identified during
            preparation, monitoring of the embankment settlement should
            have been strictly enforced, delaying pavement works until
            settlement stabilization. Nonetheless, this experience
            proved beneficial to a later highway project in Zhejiang,
            with fewer settlement problems. 3) Implementation delays
            were largely attributed to the electrical and mechanical
            works (E&M), conducive to the Bank's mandate that,
            procurement and engineering designs for E&M works, be
            completed simultaneously with civil works contracts, with
            procurement activities commencing two years prior to civil
            works completion. 4) The impulse of the Road Development
            Program to poverty alleviation, proved appropriate for
            inclusion in further rural roads projects.
